intro: Astragalus catalinensis, commonly known as the Catalina milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the island of Catalina in California. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to the arid climate of its native habitat. It plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local pollinators. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
